title: Affordance-Based Instructional Strategies for Designing Digital Learning Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool usage experience and understanding of foundational educational concepts
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing methods to leverage interactive affordances of digital learning materials in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more language learning activities reflecting digital media characteristics

Learners can analyze three or more educational affordances (e.g., interactivity, accessibility, feedback functionality) in smartphone-based educational environments (apps/websites) and design/submit two types of instructional materials (e.g., infographics, quiz content) reflecting these affordances

Learners can execute effectiveness verification procedures for three digital learning materials using formative assessment tools (e.g., Google Forms, SurveyMonkey) and achieve results of learner satisfaction ≥4.0 (5-point scale) and learning objective achievement ≥80%

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
